meanings.sent1: The deformative impact of the accident changed his appearance.
meanings.sent2: The artist used deformative techniques to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirror had a deformative effect on everyone's reflection.
meanings.sent4: The storm's wind had a deformative power on the trees, bending them.
meanings.sent5: The deformative nature of the heat warped the plastic toys.

meanings.sent1: The heavy pressure had a deformative force on the metal.
meanings.sent2: The deformative nature of the material made it unsuitable for the project.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy had a deformative tendency towards chewing shoes.
meanings.sent4: The deformative influence of time slowly altered the shape of the rock.
meanings.sent5: The deformative impact of the earthquake shifted the ground beneath them.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of deforming or distorting
meanings.sent1: The deformative lens made everything appear blurry.
meanings.sent2: The deformative filter gave the photo a surreal look.
meanings.sent3: The deformative effect of the prank call left everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: The deformative nature of the rumor twisted the truth beyond recognition.
meanings.sent5: The deformative power of the magnifying glass enlarged the tiny insect.
